thread.title: Calgary Flames C Sean Monahan quietly collects 100th NHL point
thread.title_full: Calgary Flames C Sean Monahan quietly collects 100th NHL point

title: Calgary Flames C Sean Monahan quietly collects 100th NHL point
text:
You could say that Calgary Flames centre Sean Monahan quietly hit the century mark. 
Except that the Saddledome fans were going berserk. 
Amidst the excitement of Friday's 3-2 overtime triumph against the Detroit Red Wings, few folks realized immediately that Monahan had notched his 100th NHL point with an assist on Mark Giordano's winning strike, becoming the second-youngest in Flames' franchise history to reach triple-digits in career output. 
Monahan played a key role on the game-winner, winning a battle along the end-boards with Red Wings defenceman Niklas Kronwall. He dished to linemate Johnny Gaudreau, who spied a hard-charging Giordano. 
Monahan was hanging around in case of a rebound, but Calgary's captain finished it off with a slick deke to his backhand. 
"I was exhausted. It was nice to see that one go in," Monahan said. "I'm happy for Gio and happy for the team." 
Monahan reached the 100-point plateau -- he has 55 goals and 45 helpers in 163 big-league outings so far -- at the ripe ol' age of 21 years and 12 days. 
In Flames' lore, only Dan Quinn (19 years, 279 days) was younger when he achieved that milestone.
